results.title: Cricket batting strokes. Part 2
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Crabtree. the film falls into three sections. Part two “Backplay”: Introductory shots of a school match lead to a complete analysis of back play to an off-ball and to a leg-ball. Hutton demonstrates the strokes and Crabtree coaches a class, correcting their mistakes.

results.title: Cricket batting strokes. Part 1
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batsmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Craptree. The film falls into three sections. Part one “Forward Defence and Attack”: The forward defence stroke is analysed; the stance, grip of bat and method of making the stroke are illustrated in shorts of Hutton practising at the nets. The forward attack stroke is similarly analysed.

results.title: Cricket batting strokes with Len Hutton
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batsmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Craptree. The film falls into three sections. Part one “Forward Defence and Attack”: The forward defence stroke is analysed; the stance, grip of bat and method of making the stroke are illustrated in shorts of Hutton practising at the nets. The forward attack stroke is similarly analysed. Part two “Backplay”: Introductory shots of a school match lead to a complete analysis of back play to an off-ball and to a leg-ball. Hutton demonstrates the strokes and Crabtree coaches a class, correcting their mistakes. Part three “Cut, Hook, and Glide”: Les Hutton demonstrates the use of the square cut, the late cut, the hook, and the leg glide strokes in match play and in practice at the nets. Schoolboys practice the various strokes with their coach.

results.title: Cricket
results.creator_credit: Grahame Tharp, Peter Baylis and Pathé Frères
results.brief_description: A broadcast commentary on a Test Match at Lord’s provides a background against which cricket is seen as a game; a craft; and interest of the people; a piece of history. We see the craftsmen who make the ball, and the bat - that “forth straight stick” with which the batsmen defend “the other three”; then the craftsmen who play the game, from W. G. Grace in the nets to Sir Donald Bradman and Dennis Compton in the “Tests”. The history of the game is epitomised in shots of the Long Room at Lord’s, and from there the camera moves to the village green, to the London side-street where the urchins play on a bumping pitch, to South Africa and India, where in the blinding light “there is often an hour to play the last man in.” Narrated by John Arlott and Sir Ralph Richardson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grahame Tharp, Peter Baylis and Pathé Frères

results.title: Crew roles and responsibilities
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode focuses on the camera crew - who’s who and how they do their jobs. The size of the video crew depends on the size of the story to be presented, but there are three essential crew members - the presenter, the sound recordist and the camera operator. The role of each of these in the production of a video story is thoroughly examined.

results.title: Crete: the island in history. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The relation of Crete to trade routes and centres of the ancient world is considered. The history of Crete is briefly traced, indicating the various empires which at times have occupied the island. These include: the Macedonian empire, the Roman empire, the Byzantine empire, the Saracens, the Venetians, the Ottoman empire, Greece and the German military occupation.

results.title: Crete: the island and it's people. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Characteristic activities in a small village are shown; grinding of corn, farming, irrigation, hand reaping and threshing, growing of oranges, shearing and spinning wool, pottery making using the wheel, market day activities, ploughing with a primitive plough.

results.title: Crete: an introduction to an island. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Diagrams and models illustrate the geography, topography and brief geological history of the island. Subject-matter covered includes: transport on the island; water supply for irrigation; typical scenery in Western Crete; variations in climatic conditions throughout the island; agricultural pursuits; soil erosion resulting from excessive removal of trees for firewood; declining soil fertility of the land.

results.title: Crescent moon = Yueyaer  = 月牙儿
results.creator_credit: Zhanag Fan, Wang Zhi An, Huo Zhuang, Li Dong De, Xing Dan, Xu Xiaoxing and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Based on a short story written in the 1930s by Lao She, ‘Crescent Moon’ portrays the inexorable injustice exerted by an unfair economic system, through the reminiscences of a young girl gradually forced into prostitution by poverty. Yuerong’s father dies when she is only a little girl; her mother remarries a kind patron, but he dies too. Penury pushes her mother into prostitution, for which Yuerong cannot forgive her. She leaves home and lives at school, but after graduation is unable to find work. She lets a man take care of her for a while, but then discovers he is married. Later she becomes a waitress, but loses the job when she refuses to sleep with the customers. In the end she has no choice but to follow in her mother’s footsteps.

Credits: Directors, Huo Zhuang, Xu Xiaoxing, Xing Dan ; writers, Huo Zhuang, Zhang Fan, Wang Zhi’an ; photography, Sun Cheng, Meng Fanjun ; music, Liv Zhuang ; editing, Zhon Tingmei, An Xiaohua.
Cast: Song Dandan, Siqin Gaowa.

results.title: Cremaster 5
results.headline_credit: Hungary and United States of America, 1997
results.brief_description: Cremaster 5 (55 min, 1997) is a five-act opera (sung in Hungarian) set in late-ninteenth century Budapest. The last film in the series, Cremaster 5 represents the moment when the testicles are finally released and sexual differentiation is fully attained. The lamenting tone of the opera suggests that Barney invisions this as a moment of tragedy and loss. The primary character is the Queen of Chain (played by Ursula Andress). Barney, himself, plays three characters who appear in the mind of the Queen: her Diva, Magician, and Giant. The Magician is a stand-in for Harry Houdini, who was born in Budapest in 1874 and appears as a recurring character in the Cremaster cycle.
